Contract Regulation
It is requested that a contract he negotiated with
the HAEB for the preparation of radio English-teaching
materials. The Intention of this contract should be twofold)
(1) to provide for the delivery of certain materials and
services within a stated period of time and in return for
the payment, at stated intervals, of the sum of $6,345.00;
and (2) tox provide for the continued preparation and
delivery of such materials and services, subject to the
availability of funds and the consent of both contracting
parties.
The contractual agreement as to the $6,345 may
therefore be considered as Phase #1 of the contract. In
this phase the following requirements should be provided
for:
I Personnel) The contracting parties will cooperate
in finding persons qualifled to do the work under
the contract. However, no person may be engaged
by the HAEB without the approval of the AR/00.
II Materials and Services to be Delivered under Phase #1.
I* A series of 39 15~»inute Intermediate-level
scripts dealing with intonation, rhythm, and
pronunciation
2. A series of 13 analysis-commentaries on
suitable poems, the commentaries done so that
they can be used as the bases of "English
through Poetry” scripts.
